notes.text:
A security update is now available for Red Hat Single Sign-On 7.2 from the Customer Portal.

Red Hat Product Security has rated this update as having a security impact of Moderate. A Common Vulnerability Scoring System (CVSS) base score, which gives a detailed severity rating, is available for each vulnerability from the CVE link(s) in the References section.
notes.title: Topic

notes.text:
Red Hat Single Sign-On 7.2 is a standalone server, based on the Keycloak project, that provides authentication and standards-based single sign-on capabilities for web and mobile applications.

This release of Red Hat Single Sign-On 7.2.6 serves as a replacement for Red Hat Single Sign-On 7.2.5, and includes bug fixes and enhancements, which are documented in the Release Notes document linked to in the References.

Security Fix(es):

* undertow: Infoleak in some circumstances where Undertow can serve data from a random buffer (CVE-2018-14642)

* console: wildfly-core: Cross-site scripting (XSS) in JBoss Management Console (CVE-2018-10934)

* dom4j: XML Injection in Class: Element. Methods: addElement, addAttribute which can impact the integrity of XML documents (CVE-2018-1000632)

For more details about the security issue(s), including the impact, a CVSS score, and other related information, refer to the CVE page(s) listed in the References section.
notes.title: Details

publisher.issuing_authority: Red Hat Product Security is responsible for vulnerability handling across all Red Hat products and services.
publisher.name: Red Hat Product Security

document.title: Red Hat Security Advisory: Red Hat Single Sign-On 7.2.6 security update

cwe.name: Improper Neutralization of Input During Web Page Generation ('Cross-site Scripting')

notes.text: A cross-site scripting (XSS) vulnerability was found in the JBoss Management Console versions before 7.1.6.CR1, 7.1.6.GA. Users with roles that can create objects in the application can exploit this to attack other privileged users.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: wildfly-core: Cross-site scripting (XSS) in JBoss Management Console
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
notes.title: CVSS score applicability

remediations.details:
Before applying the update, back up your existing installation, including all applications, configuration files, and databases and database settings.

The References section of this erratum contains a download link. You must log in to download the update.

vulnerabilities.title: wildfly-core: Cross-site scripting (XSS) in JBoss Management Console

cwe.name: Exposure of Sensitive Information to an Unauthorized Actor

notes.text: An information leak vulnerability was found in Undertow. If all headers are not written out in the first write() call then the code that handles flushing the buffer will always write out the full contents of the writevBuffer buffer, which may contain data from previous requests.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: undertow: Infoleak in some circumstances where Undertow can serve data from a random buffer
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
notes.title: CVSS score applicability

cwe.name: Improper Neutralization of Argument Delimiters in a Command ('Argument Injection')

notes.text: dom4j version prior to version 2.1.1 contains a CWE-91: XML Injection vulnerability in Class: Element. Methods: addElement, addAttribute that can result in an attacker tampering with XML documents through XML injection. This attack appear to be exploitable via an attacker specifying attributes or elements in the XML document. This vulnerability appears to have been fixed in 2.1.1 or later.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: dom4j: XML Injection in Class: Element. Methods: addElement, addAttribute which can impact the integrity of XML documents
